Pre-Game Insights: The Los Angeles Angels aim to break a four-game losing streak against the Houston Astros, who are first in the AL West with an 80-68 record, while the Angels are fifth with a 60-88 record.
The game is the ninth meeting between the two teams this season, with the Astros leading the series 5-3.
Taylor Ward leads the Angels with 23 home runs, while Yordan Alvarez leads the Astros with a.310 batting average and 34 home runs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros have a strong road record at 38-36, while the Angels have struggled in home games with a 30-44 record.
The matchup features probable pitchers Ronel Blanco for the Astros and Caden Dana for the Angels.
